\index{nparr\_from\_binary() (in module micropolarray.processing.convert)@\spxentry{nparr\_from\_binary()}\spxextra{in module micropolarray.processing.convert}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{micropolarray.processing:micropolarray.processing.convert.nparr_from_binary}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{micropolarray.processing.convert.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{nparr\_from\_binary}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{filename}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Converts a PolarCam binary file into a numpy array. Bytes are saved like this
\begin{itemize}
\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{24 bit (3 bytes)}
\sphinxAtStartPar
1             |   3                |     2
111111111111       | 1111               | 11111111

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{2 numbers}
\sphinxAtStartPar
First number 12bit | Second number (little endian) 8+4=12 bit

\end{description}

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filename}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} name of the file to be converted

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ValueError}} \textendash{} file lenghts is indivisible by the number of chunks requested to parallelize operations

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
array of data from file

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
np.array

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates the demodulation tensor images and saves them. Requires a set of images with different polarizations to fit a Malus curve model.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{polarizer\_orientations}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} List containing the orientations of the incoming light for each image.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filenames\_list}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} List of input images filenames to read. Must include {[}0, 45, 90, \sphinxhyphen{}45{]}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{micropol\_phases\_previsions}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} Previsions for the micropolarizer orientations required to initialize fit.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{gain}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Detector {[}e\sphinxhyphen{}/DN{]}, required to compute errors.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{output\_dir}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} output folder to save matrix to.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{binning}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Output matrices binning. Defaults to 1 (no binning). Be warned that binning matrices AFTER calculation is an incorrect operation.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{occulter}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} occulter y, x center and radius to exclude from calculations. Defaults to None.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{procs\_grid}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} number of processors per side {[}Y, X{]}, parallelization will be done in a Y x X grid. Defaults to {[}4,4{]} (16 procs in a 4x4 grid).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dark\_filename}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Dark image filename to correct input images. Defaults to None.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{flat\_filename}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Flat image filename to correct input images. Defaults to None.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{normalizing\_S}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} maximum signal used to normalize single pixel signal. If not set will be estimated as the 4sigma of the signal distribution.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ValueError}} \textendash{} Raised if any among {[}0, 45, 90, \sphinxhyphen{}45{]} is not included in the input polarizations.

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Notes}

\sphinxAtStartPar
In the binning process the sum of values is considered, which is ok because data is normalized over the maximum S before being fitted.

\index{demosaicmean() (in module micropolarray.processing.demosaic)@\spxentry{demosaicmean()}\spxextra{in module micropolarray.processing.demosaic}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{micropolarray.processing:micropolarray.processing.demosaic.demosaicmean}}
\pysigstartsignatures

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Loops over right polarization pixel location, takes 1/4 of that,
stores it in the 2x2 superpixel.
demo\_images{[}0{]} = data{[}y=0, x=0{]}
demo\_images{[}1{]} = data{[}y=0, x=1{]}
demo\_images{[}2{]} = data{[}y=1, x=0{]}
demo\_images{[}3{]} = data{[}y=1, x=1{]}

\end{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{micropolarray.processing.nrgf.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{find\_occulter\_position}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{data}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{array}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{method}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{str}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}sigmoid\textquotesingle{}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{threshold}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{float}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{4.0}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Finds the occulter position of an image.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.array}}) \textendash{} input data

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{method}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Method to find occulter edges. If “sigmoid” it will try to fit four sigmoids at the image edges centers, inferring the occulter edges from the parameters. If “algo” it will start from the image edge center and infer the occulter position when DN{[}i{]} \textgreater{} threshold*mean(DN{[}:i{]}) Defaults to “sigmoid”.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{threshold}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Threshold for the algo method. Defaults to 4.0.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{UnboundLocalError}} \textendash{} couldn’t converge

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
occulter y, occulter x, occulter radius

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
list

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{nrgf() (in module micropolarray.processing.nrgf)@\spxentry{nrgf()}\spxextra{in module micropolarray.processing.nrgf}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{micropolarray.processing:micropolarray.processing.nrgf.nrgf}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{micropolarray.processing.nrgf.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{nrgf}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{data}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{array}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{y\_center}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }None}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{x\_center}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }None}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{rho\_min}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }None}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{step}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{1}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{phi\_to\_mean}\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}0.0, 360{]}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{output\_phi}\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}0.0, 360{]}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ array}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Performs nrgf filtering on the image, starting from center and radius. Mean is performed between phi\_to\_mean, 0 is horizontal right, anti\sphinxhyphen{}clockwise.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.array}}) \textendash{} input array

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y\_center}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} pixel y coordinate of the nrgf center. Defaults to None (image y center).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x\_center}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} pixel x coordinate of the nrgf center. Defaults to (image x center).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rho\_min}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} minimun radius in pixels to perform nrgf to. Defaults to None (radius 0).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{step}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} step to which apply the nrgf from center, in pixels. Defaults to 1 pixel.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns the input array in a circular selection, otherwise an arbitrary number. If a pixel is not in the selection the ENTIRE superpixel is considered out of selection. If return\_boolean is True then a boolean array is returned instead (useful for mean/stdev operations).

Basic image class. Can be initialized from a filename, a filenames list, a numpy array or another Image instance. If multiple filenames are provided, will perform the mean of them unless averageimages is False.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Micro\sphinxhyphen{}polarizer array image class. Can be initialized from a 2d array, a list of 1 or more file names (use the boolean keyword averageimages to select if sum or average is taken) or another MicropolImage. Dark and flat micropolarray images can also be provided to automatically correct the result.

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{micropolarray:micropolarray.micropol_image.MicropolImage.shift}}
\pysigstartsignatures

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Shifts image by y, x pixels and fills with 0 the remaining space. Positive numbers for up/right shift and negative for down/left shift. Image is split into polarizations, each one is shifted, then they are merged again.

\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} vertical shift in pix

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} horizontal shift in pix

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
shifted image copied from the original

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{micropolarray:micropolarray.micropol_image.MicropolImage}]{\sphinxcrossref{MicropolImage}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Auxiliary class for polarization parameters.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Members:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
ID (str): parameter identifier
data (np.array): parameter image as numpy 2D array
title (str): brief title of the parameter, useful for plotting
measure\_unit (str): initial measure units of the parameter
fix\_data (bool): controls whether data has to be constrained to {[}0, 4096{]} interval (not implemented yet)

\end{description}

\index{get\_Bsun\_units() (in module micropolarray.utils)@\spxentry{get\_Bsun\_units()}\spxextra{in module micropolarray.utils}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{micropolarray:micropolarray.utils.get_Bsun_units}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{micropolarray.utils.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_Bsun\_units}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{diffuser\_I}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{float}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{texp\_image}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{float}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{1.0}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{texp\_diffuser}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{float}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{1.0}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ float}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns the conversion unit for expressing brightness in units of sun brightness. Usage is
data {[}units of B\_sun{]} = data{[}DN{]} * get\_Bsun\_units(mean\_Bsun\_brightness, texp\_image, texp\_diffuser)
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
